 Faculty Staff Assistance Program 
   
 The University of California, Riverside is pleased to announce that it has partnered with ComPsych®, the new Faculty & Staff Assistance Program provider. ComPsych will provide GuidanceResources® services whose benefits will provide UCR faculty, staff and their household family members confidential support, resources and information for personal and work-life issues. These services are provided at no charge and include: 
 
 Guidance Resources® Benefits 
 
 
 Confidential Counseling 
 
 GuidanceResources benefits are designed to provide free short-term counseling services for UCR faculty, staff and their household family members to help handle concerns constructively, before they become major issues. Call anytime about concerns such as marital, relationship and family problems; stress, anxiety and depression; grief and loss, job pressures and substance abuse. 
 
 Work-Life 
			Solutions 
 
 The work-life specialists at ComPsych will do the research and provide qualified referrals and customized resources for child and elder care, moving, pet care, college planning, home repair, buying a car, planning an event, selling a house and more. For detailed information about the services provided, please review the  Work-Life Benefits flyer . 
 
 Legal 
			Support 
 
 With the GuidanceResources program, there is an attorney “on call” whenever there are questions about legal matters. Speak with on-staff licensed attorneys about legal concerns such as divorce, custody, adoption, real estate, debt and bankruptcy, landlord/tenant issues, civil and criminal actions and more. If representation is required, you can be referred to a qualified attorney for a free 30-minute consultation and a 25 percent reduction in customary legal fees. Learn more about legal support by reviewing the  Legal Benefits flyer . 
 
 Financial 
			Information 
 
 
 With the GuidanceResources benefit, you can get answers about budgeting, debt management, tax issues and other money concerns from on-staff CPAs, Certified Financial Planners® and other financial experts, simply by calling your toll-free number. To get additional information, please review the  Financial Benefits flyer . 
 
 
 GuidanceResources® Online 
 
 Visit  Guidance Resources online  to access timely, expert information on thousands of topics, including relationships, work, school, children, wellness, legal, financial and free time. You can search for qualified child and elder care, attorneys and financial planners, as well as ask questions, take self-assessments and more. 
 
 Bright Horizons Care Advantage 
 
 
 To help you balance work and family responsibilities, UC offers Bright Horizons Care Advantage, a comprehensive web-based resource. 
 Faculty and staff serve the UC community every day – but their responsibilities rarely end with their jobs. The  Bright Horizons Care Advantage  programs help you find pre-screened care resources that fit your family’s needs.  For more information about this system wide UC benefit, visit the  UC Family Care Resources webpage . 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Faculty Staff Assistance Program Resources 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Contact Us 
Anytime Anywhere 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When you call, you will speak with a GuidanceConsultant SM , a master’s- or PhD-level counselor who will collect some general information about you and will talk with you about your needs. The GuidanceConsultant SM  will provide the name of a counselor who can assist you. You can then set up an appointment to speak with the counselor over the phone or schedule a face-to-face visit. 
 Your toll-free number gives you direct, 24/7 access to a GuidanceConsultant SM , who will answer your questions and, if needed, refer you to a counselor or other resources. 
 24/7 Support 
 Call: (866) 615-3047 
 TTY: (800) 697-0353 
 Log on today to connect directly with a GuidanceConsultant SM  about your issue or to consult articles, podcasts, videos and other helpful tools. 
 Online:  guidanceresources.com 
 App: GuidanceNow SM 
 Web ID: UCRFSAP 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Manager/Supervisor 
Resources 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Managing people in the modern workforce isn’t easy. Everyone is busy. Stress is common. Tempers are short. Then a life event—a death in the family, a medical crisis or a need for emergency child care—occurs and work grinds to a halt. 
 The Faculty & Staff Assistance Program is the response to such crises. The program is made available at no cost to employees, as well as household family members, and offers confidential, professional counseling and other resources for resolving personal, family or workplace issues. As a supervisor or manager, view the program as a tool to keep these personal issues from spilling over into the workplace or unduly affecting employee behavior and performance. 
 Please review the following resources for managers and supervisors: 
 Toolkit for Managers and Supervisors 
 Manager Supervisor Q&A
